intro: Pilosella bihariensis, commonly known as the Himalayan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in a dense head, and the leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella bihariensis is often found in meadows and slopes at elevations ranging from 2,500 to 5,000 meters.
